questiontext.text: Select the following vector fields which are conservative:

generalfeedback.text:
We determine whether the vector fields are conservative by considering their curl:

(a) \(\underline{F} = (x − y)\underline{i} + (x + y)\underline{j}\) \[\begin{aligned} \underline{\nabla} \times \underline{F} &= \begin{vmatrix} \underline{i} &\underline{j} & \underline{k} \\ \frac{\partial}{\partial x} & \frac{\partial}{\partial y} & \frac{\partial}{\partial z} \\ (x − y) & (x + y) & 0 \end{vmatrix}\\ &= \left( \frac{\partial}{\partial y}(0) - \frac{\partial}{\partial z}(x+y)\right)\underline{i} - \left( \frac{\partial}{\partial x}(0) - \frac{\partial}{\partial z}(x-y)\right)\underline{j} + \left( \frac{\partial}{\partial x}(x+y) - \frac{\partial}{\partial y}(x-y)\right)\underline{k}\\ &= 2\underline{k} \neq \underline{0} \end{aligned}\] So this vector field isn't conservative.

(b) \(\underline{F} = 3x^2y^2\underline{i} + (2x^3y − 1)\underline{j}\) \[\begin{aligned} \underline{\nabla} \times \underline{F} &= \begin{vmatrix} \underline{i} &\underline{j} & \underline{k} \\ \frac{\partial}{\partial x} & \frac{\partial}{\partial y} & \frac{\partial}{\partial z} \\ (3x^2y^2) & (2x^3y − 1) & 0 \end{vmatrix}\\ &= \left( \frac{\partial}{\partial y}(0) - \frac{\partial}{\partial z}((2x^3y − 1))\right)\underline{i} - \left( \frac{\partial}{\partial x}(0) - \frac{\partial}{\partial z}(3x^2y^2)\right)\underline{j} + \left( \frac{\partial}{\partial x}((2x^3y − 1)) - \frac{\partial}{\partial y}(3x^2y^2)\right)\underline{k}\\ &= (6x^2y-6x^2y)\underline{k}\\ &= \underline{0} \end{aligned}\] So this vector field is conservative.

(c) \(\underline{F} = 2x\underline{i} + (xz − 2)\underline{j} + xy\underline{k}\) \[\begin{aligned} \underline{\nabla} \times \underline{F} &= \begin{vmatrix} \underline{i} &\underline{j} & \underline{k} \\ \frac{\partial}{\partial x} & \frac{\partial}{\partial y} & \frac{\partial}{\partial z} \\ 2x & (xz − 2) & xy \end{vmatrix}\\ &= \left( \frac{\partial}{\partial y}(xy) - \frac{\partial}{\partial z}((xz − 2))\right)\underline{i} - \left( \frac{\partial}{\partial x}(xy) - \frac{\partial}{\partial z}(2x)\right)\underline{j} + \left( \frac{\partial}{\partial x}((xz − 2)) - \frac{\partial}{\partial y}(2x)\right)\underline{k}\\ &= (x-x)\underline{i} - (x - 0)\underline{j}) + (z-0)\underline{k}\\ &=-x\underline{j} + z\underline{k} \neq \underline{0} \end{aligned}\] So this vector field isn't conservative.

(d) \(\underline{F} = x^2z\underline{i} + y^2z\underline{j} + \dfrac{1}{3} (x^3 + y^3)\underline{k}\) \[\begin{aligned} \underline{\nabla} \times \underline{F} &= \begin{vmatrix} \underline{i} &\underline{j} & \underline{k} \\ \frac{\partial}{\partial x} & \frac{\partial}{\partial y} & \frac{\partial}{\partial z} \\ x^2z & y^2z & \frac{1}{3} (x^3 + y^3) \end{vmatrix}\\ &= \left( \frac{\partial}{\partial y}(\frac{1}{3} (x^3 + y^3)) - \frac{\partial}{\partial z}((y^2z))\right)\underline{i} - \left( \frac{\partial}{\partial x}(\frac{1}{3} (x^3 + y^3)) - \frac{\partial}{\partial z}(x^2z)\right)\underline{j} + \left( \frac{\partial}{\partial x}((y^2z)) - \frac{\partial}{\partial y}(x^2z)\right)\underline{k}\\ &= (y^2-y^2)\underline{i} - (x^2 - x^2)\underline{j}) + (0-0)\underline{k}\\\\ &= \underline{0} \end{aligned}\] So this vector field is conservative.
